Part 1
You must answer this question.
Your class is organising a surprise birthday party for Mr Brown, your English teacher. You have been asked to invite his wife to the party and to ask her advice on what present to buy for Mr Brown. Read the extract from your diary and your notes. Then, using all the information, write a letter on behalf of your class to Mrs Brown.
Monday 15th June
Tuesday 16th June Mr Brown's party 3 - 6 pm College Canteen
Wednesday 17th June
Notes for letter to Mrs Brown
invite Mrs Brown: explain that party is a surprise
give details: date, time and place food, music, etc.
say who's coming: class, teachers, Principal
ask about present: CD? Book? ...?
Write a letter of between 120 and 180 words in an appropriate style on the opposite page. Do not write any postal addresses.
Part 2
Write an answer to one of the questions 2 - 5 in this part. Write your answer in 120 - 180 words in an appropriate style on the opposite page. Put the question number in the box at the top of page 5.
You have been asked to write an article for your school magazine with the title:
My favourite season of the year.
Describe your favourite season and explain why it is so special for you.
Write your article
Your English teacher has asked you to write a story for the school magazine. The story must begin with the following words:
John said he had some good news to tell me.
Write your story.
You have had a class discussion on family life. Now your English teacher has asked you to write a composition, giving your opinions on this question:
How important is family life today?
Write your composition.
Answer one of the following two questions based on your reading of one of these set books. Write (a) or (b) as well as the number 5 in the question box, and the title of the book next to the box. Your answer must be about one of the books below.

Either
Your English teacher has asked you to help prepare a poster about the book or one of the short stories you have read. Write a report for your teacher suggesting what should be shown on the poster and saying what information the poster could contain, to encourage students to ready the book.
Or
Some books win literary prizes because they are special in some way. Would you give a prize to the book you have read? Write a composition, explaining your views with reference to the book or one of the short stories you have read.
